author: S Prasad
text:
Students of SVS College of Naturopathy and Yoga Science in Villupuram continued with their protest in front of the GH for the second day demanding the immediate arrest of the administrator Vasuki and her husband and refund of their tuition fees collected by the management.

All India Mahila Congress secretary Haseena Syed and Tamil Nadu State secretary Jansirani on Monday visited the GH and extended support to the protest.

Talking to reporters, Ms. Syed charged that the district administration had failed to take action on the complaints of students on lack of infrastructure. The government should order a judicial probe into the death of the students and provide adequate compensation to their families. The government should also transfer students studying in the college to other institutions, she said.

Meanwhile, senior police officials convinced parents who refused to accept the bodies of girls of a fair investigation.

The post-mortem of Saranya and Priyanka was conducted on Sunday evening and the bodies were handed over to the families. However, parents of Monisha from Chennai stood their ground and refused to accept the body after the post-mortem on Monday.

‘Government should order a judicial probe into the death of the students’
title: Parents of girls stage protest
